title: Cape Lookout National Seashore: Shackleford Horses
body: Shackleford Horses       A herd of 110 to 130 wild horses roams free on Shackleford Banks, a 9 mile long by 1 mile wide island at the southern end of Cape Lookout National Seashore. Discover their history and learn more about the lives of the Shackleford horses.  Â                      Wild Horses of Shackleford Banks In the southern portion of Cape Lookout National Seashore, there lies an island which is home to one of the few remaining wild horse herds in the eastern United States.  Duration:5 minutes, 56 seconds
